step.description: Restriction digestion
Place the tube containing the restriction enzyme mix, labeled ENZ, on ice.
step.comments: Which enzymes does the enzyme mix contain? Why is it interesting to use more than one enzyme?

step.description: Place the tubes with the DNA samples in the foam micro test tube holder.
Pipet 10 μl of each DNA sample from the stock tubes and transfer to the correct micro test tubes.
step.comments: Which names do you have chosen for the micro test tubes?

step.description: Pipet 10 μl of enzyme mix (ENZ) into micro test tubes with DNA.
Tightly cap the tubes and mix the components.
Place the tubes in the foam micro tube holder and incubate for 45 min at 37°C.
step.comments: Why 37°C is a good temperature for the enzymes?

step.description: After the incubation period, remove the tubes from the water bath and place in the refrigerator or proceed directly to the Agarose Gel Electropheresis protocol.
Agarose gel electrophoresis
If a centrifuge is available, pulse spin the tubes in the centrifuge to bring all of the liquid into the bottom of the tube or gently tap on the table top.
Add 5 μl of loading dye "LD" into each tube. Cap the tubes and mix. Collect the sample at the bottom of the tube.
Remove the agarose gel from the refrigerator (if applicable) and remove the plastic wrap.
Place the agarose gel in the electrophoresis apparatus.
step.comments: On which side of the box do you have to put the wells of the gel?

step.description: Fill the electrophoresis chamber with TAE buffer to cover the gel, using approximately 275 ml of buffer for a Bio-Rad Mini-Sub Cell, horizontal electrophoresis chamber.
step.comments: There are two options for using TAE Buffer: 1. 1x TAE buffer 2. 0,25 TAE buffer

step.description: Load each sample into the wells of the gel. - 10 μl DNA size Marker (M) - 20 μl DNA samples
step.comments: What is the DNA size Marker for?

step.description: Carefully place the lid on the electrophoresis chamber. The lid will attach to the base in only one orientation. The red and black jacks on the lid of the horizontal electrophoresis chambers will match with the red and black jacks on the base. Plug the electrodes into the power supply, red to red and black to black.
Turn on the power and electrophorese your samples at: - 1x TAE buffer: 100 V for 30 minutes. - 0,25x TAE buffer: 200 V for 20 minutes
Visualization of DNA Fragments

When the electrophoresis run is complete, turn off the power and remove the top of the chamber. Carefully remove the gel and tray from the gel box. Be careful — the gel is very slippery. Slide the gel into the staining tray.
Add 120 ml of 100x Fast Blast DNA stain into a staining tray (2 gels per tray).
Stain the gels for 2 minutes with gentle agitation. Save the used stain for future use.
Transfer the gels into a large washing container and rinse with warm (40–55°C) tap water for approximately 10 seconds.
Destain by washing twice in warm tap water for 5 minutes each with gentle shaking for best results.
Record results.

material.name: Marqueur de taille (ADN digéré par HindIII)
